name: Public Health BA
overview: The Public Health major is a designated capstone major. The goal of the capstone is to provide a culminating experience for students in which they complete an integrative, scholarly, or applied project that reflects the knowledge and skills gained in the program to a public health problem or issue.

sections.title: Preparation for the Major
sections.description: Complete the following courses and course groups. Each course must be taken for a letter grade.

options.title: Chemistry and Biochemistry
options.description: Select one course from the following. A score of 4 or 5 on the Advanced Placement Chemistry examination may satisfy the requirement.

options.title: Life Sciences
options.description: Select one course from the following. A score of 4 or 5 on the Advanced Placement Biology examination may satisfy the requirement.

requirements.title: Health and Society
requirements.description: Complete one course from an approved list available on the school website.

requirements.title: Cultural Competency
requirements.description: Complete one course from an approved list available on the school website.

requirements.title: Communication Fundamentals
requirements.description: Complete COMM 1 - Principles of Oral Communication or any approved Writing II course.

sections.title: The Major
sections.description: Complete all requirements from the following four groups.

requirements.title: Foundations of Public Health Knowledge and Practice
Public Health Electives
requirements.description: Complete three upper-division courses (minimum of 12 units) selected from the school's undergraduate course offerings. No more than 4 units from courses numbered 195 to 199 may be applied toward the elective requirement.

requirements.title: Community Engagement
requirements.description: Complete PUB HLT 195CE - Community and Corporate Internship in Public Health or an approved course.

sections.title: Honors Program
sections.description: To receive School Honors, students must complete all upper-division courses in the major with an overall grade-point average of 3.5 or better. For highest School Honors, students must also complete a senior thesis.

requirements.title: Highest Honors Thesis Requirement
requirements.description: To receive highest School Honors, complete a senior thesis by taking either Public Health 198 or a departmental 198 course. This course may not be counted as an elective course toward the major.
